intro: Cephalaria ebusitana, commonly known as the Ebusi cephalaria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are usually narrow and sometimes hairy, providing a distinctive appearance. Cephalaria ebusitana is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
